intro: Thesium ferganense, commonly known as the Fergana thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to Central Asia, particularly found in regions of Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, herbaceous structure with narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the summer months. Thesium ferganense is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils.
